member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVoidActionHandler
member.summary: Interface for specifying behavior for a void returning intercepted calls. The interface is returned by method.
member.remarks: This interface allow tweaking the behavior of methods which return void.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IMethodBehavior
member.summary: Interface for specifying behavior for a method call. The interface is extended by and .
member.remarks: This interface allow tweaking the behavior of any method by calling its original implementation or throwing an exception from it.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IHideObjectMethods
member.summary: For internal use only.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IMethodBehavior.CallOriginal
member.summary: Specify that an intercepted call will try to execute the real logic of the intercepted instance.
member.remarks:
This interface is returned by method.
Before using this directive make sure that the intercepted method has a real implementation that can be executed.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IMethodBehavior.WillThrow(System.Exception)
member.summary: Specify that an intercepted call will throw the given exception.
member.remarks: This interface is returned by method.
member.param: The exception to throw

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVoidActionHandler.IgnoreCall
member.summary: Specify that an intercepted call should be ignored without executing any logic.
member.remarks: This interface is returned by method.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVoidActionHandler.DoInstead(System.Action{TypeMock.MethodCallContext})
member.summary: Run a custom action instead of the methods in the WhenCalled block.
member.param: The action that will run instead of the faked method

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IPublicVoidActionHandler.WithExactArguments
member.summary: Specifies that the behavior will only be set on method calls with the exact arguments.

remarks.para: WithExactArguments() is a completing statement for .

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicMethodHandler
member.summary: Returned by Isolate.NonPublic., this interface contains methods for defining behavior for non public methods, as will as a modifier for applying behavior for generic methods

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicMethodBehavior
member.summary: Returned by Isolate.NonPublic., and Isolate.NonPublic.WhenCalled().. this interface contains methods for defining behavior for non public methods, as will as a modifier for applying behavior for generic methods

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IReturnValueHandler`1
member.summary: Interface for specifying behavior for intercepted calls on methods returning values. The interface is returned by .
member.remarks: This interface allow tweaking the behavior of methods that has return values.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IReturnValueHandler`1.WillReturn(`0)
member.summary: Specify that the intercepted method will return the given value. The real implementation will not be executed.
member.param: The fake value to return when the call is intercepted

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IReturnValueHandler`1.DoInstead(System.Func{TypeMock.MethodCallContext,`0})
member.summary: Run a custom function instead of the methods in the WhenCalled block.
member.param: The function that will run instead of the faked method

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicMethodHandler.WithGenericArguments(System.Type,System.Type[])
member.summary: Specifies generic type arguments that apply to a non-public method to set behavior on. The behavior will be set only for a method bound to the passed type arguments
member.param: The first generic type argument the method binds to
Optional. Further generic type arguments the method binds to.
member.remarks: WithGenericArguments() modifies a call to Isolate.NonPublic.. Due to the fluent nature of the AAA API it should be used with its proceeding methods; see .

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicVerifier
member.summary: Returned by Isolate.Verify., this interface contains methods for verifying non public (private, protected and internal) method, property and index calls, and checking argumentrs.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicVerifier.WasCalled(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public method has been called
member.param: The fake object to verify method behavior on
The method to verify behavior for
member.returns: An interface reference, used to add argument checking
member.remarks: In order to perform additional argument checking as part of the verification, use the proceeding method.
member.exception: Thrown if the method was not called.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicVerifier.WasCalled(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public static method has been called
member.param: The type to verify static method behavior on
The method to verify behavior for
member.returns: An interface reference, used to add argument checking
member.remarks: In order to perform additional argument checking as part of the verification, use the proceeding method.
member.exception: Thrown if the method was not called.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicVerifier.WasNotCalled(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public method was not called regardless of parameters.
member.param: The fake object to verify method behavior on
The method to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the method was called at least once.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicVerifier.WasNotCalled(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public static method was not called regardless of parameters.
member.param: The type to verify static method behavior on
The method to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the method was called at least once.

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicVerifier.Property
member.summary: A read only property, used to verify calls on non-public properties
member.remarks:
Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use Property with one of its proceeding methods, see .
When handling non public (private, protected, internal) properties all access to property names is string-based.

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicVerifier.Indexer
member.summary: A read only property, used to verify calls on non-public indexers
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use Indexer with one of its proceeding methods, see .

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier
member.summary: Returned by Isolate.Verify.NonPublic., this interface contains methods for verifying non public (private, protected and internal) properties

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier.WasCalledGet(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public property getter has been called
member.param: The fake object to verify property behavior on
The non-public property to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the property get was not called.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier.WasCalledGet(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public static property getter has been called
member.param: The type to verify static property get behavior on
The non-public property to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the property get was not called.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier.WasCalledSet(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public property setter has been called with a specific value
member.param: The fake object to verify property behavior on
The non-public property to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the property set was not called or if it was called with a mismatching value.
member.remarks: In order to specify the argument to verify use the proceeding method .

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier.WasCalledSet(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public static property setter has been called with a specific value
member.param: The type to verify static property get behavior on
The non-public property to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the property set was not called or if it was called with a mismatching value.
member.remarks: In order to specify the argument to verify use the proceeding method .

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier.WasNotCalledGet(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public property get was not called regardless of parameters.
member.param: The fake object to verify property behavior on
The property to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the property getter was called at least once.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier.WasNotCalledGet(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public static property get was not called regardless of parameters.
member.param: The type to verify static property behavior on
The property to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the property getter was called at least once.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier.WasNotCalledSet(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public property set was not called regardless of parameters.
member.param: The fake object to verify property behavior on
The property to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the property setter was called at least once.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.INonPublicPropertyVerifier.WasNotCalledSet(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a non-public static property set was not called regardless of parameters.
member.param: The type to verify static property behavior on
The property to verify behavior for
member.exception: Thrown if the property setter was called at least once.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IArguments
member.summary: Returned by Isolate.Verify., this interface is used to verify the call was made with specific arguments

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IArguments.WithArguments(System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Verify the call was made with the specified arguments
member.param: Mandatory. The first argument to verify.
Optional. Additional arguments to verify.

remarks.para: This method is used to complement verifying calls, using Isolate.Verify.NonPublic., with specific argument verification.
All expected call arguments must be passed to this method in order for verification to be performed.

member.exception: Thrown if the call was made with mismatching arguments

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IArgumentVerifier
member.summary: Returned by Isolate.Verify.Property. and Isolate.Verify., this interface is used to verify a property setter call was made with the correct argument

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IArgumentVerifier.WithArgument(System.Object)
member.summary: Verify the property set call was made with the specified argument
member.param: The property set value to verify.
member.remarks: This method is used to complement verifying property set, using Isolate.Verify.NonPublic.Property., with specific argument verification.
member.exception: Thrown if the property set call was made with a mismatching argument

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIndexerVerifier
member.summary: Returned by Isolate.Verify., this interface contains methods for verifying non public (private, protected and internal) index calls.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIndexerVerifier.WasCalledGet(System.Object)
member.summary: Verify a call has been made to a non-private index getter
member.param: The fake object to verify index behavior on
member.remarks: In order to verify the index getter has been called at a specific index location, use the proceeding method .

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIndexerVerifier.WasCalledSet(System.Object)
member.summary: Verify a call has been made to a non-private index setter
member.param: The fake object to verify index behavior on
member.remarks: In order to verify the index getter has been called at a specific index location and value, use the proceeding method .

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIndexerVerifier.WasNotCalledGet(System.Object)
member.summary: Verify a call has not been made to a non-private index getter
member.param: The fake object to verify index behavior on

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIndexerVerifier.WasNotCalledSet(System.Object)
member.summary: Verify a call has not been made to a non-private index setter
member.param: The fake object to verify index behavior on

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIndexerGetVerifier
member.summary: Returned by Isolate.Verify., this interface is used to verify an index getter was called with a specific index.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIndexerGetVerifier.WithIndex``1(``0)
member.summary: Verify the index getter was made with the specific index location
member.param: The index location value to verify
member.typeparam: The type of the index used. Can be inferred from
member.remarks: This method is used to complement verifying index getter calls, using Isolate.Verify.NonPublic.Indexer., with specific index location verification.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIndexerSetVerifier.WithIndexAndValue``2(``0,``1)
member.summary: Verify the index setter was called with a specific index location and setter value
member.param: The index location value to verify
The setter value to verify
member.typeparam: The type of the index used. Can be inferred from
The type of the setter value used. Can be inferred from
member.remarks: This method is used to complement verifying index setter calls, using Isolate.Verify.NonPublic.Indexer., with specific index location and value verification.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ICollectionReturnHandler
member.summary: Interface for tweaking behavior for methods returning collection types. This can be used to replace collection values returned by a method or property with another test data collection. This interface is returned by the method.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ICollectionReturnHandler.WillReturnCollectionValuesOf(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Swaps a collection returned by a method or property with a collection of test data. Follows a call to .
member.param: The collection to use instead of the replaced collection

remarks.para: This method is used as a completing statement to , and is used to replace the collection in the preceeding statement with the provided collection. This is useful when the code under test uses collection data that is prepared externally and then iterated over. The collection containing this data can be swapped with a test data collection prepared during the test set up and thus remove the dependency on the code populating the collection.

Note: because Typemock Isolator does not currently support faking objects implemented in MsCorLib.dll, the source collection used with WhenCalled() cannot be one implemented in MsCorLib, such as and .

member.exception: If the lambda expression provided in Isolate.WhenCalled() does not evaluate to an object implementing .

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IInvoker
member.summary: Interface for invoking events.
member.remarks: This interface is returned by the property.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IInvoker.Event(System.Action,System.Object[])
member.summary: Fires an event.
member.param: Accepts a method in the form of a Lambda expression containing a call to the adder of the event being fired. Example: () => logger.LogEntryCreated += null.
The parameters to fire the event with.
member.exception: Thrown when the number of arguments does not match the number of arguments the events expects.
Thrown when the arguments does not match the parameters types the event expects.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IInvoker.Method(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes a method represented by the current instance, using the specified parameters
member.param: The object on which to invoke the method.
The name of the method

An argument list for the invoked method. This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method or constructor to be invoked. If there are no parameters, parameters should be a null reference
member.returns: An object containing the return value of the invoked method, or a null reference in the case of a constructor.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IInvoker.Method(System.Type,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes a static method represented by the current type, using the specified parameters
member.param: The Type on which to invoke the method.
The name of the method

An argument list for the invoked method. This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method or constructor to be invoked. If there are no parameters, parameters should be a null reference
member.returns: An object containing the return value of the invoked method, or a null reference in the case of a constructor.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IInvoker.Method``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes a static method represented by the current type, using the specified parameters
member.typeparam: The Type on which to invoke the method.
member.param: The name of the method

An argument list for the invoked method. This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method or constructor to be invoked. If there are no parameters, parameters should be a null reference
member.returns: An object containing the return value of the invoked method, or a null reference in the case of a constructor.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ISwapperBehavior`1.With(`0)
member.summary: Specify the fake instance that will replace the created instance.
member.param: the fake instance that will replace the created instance

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ISwapperBehavior`1.WithRecursiveFake
member.summary: Replace the created instance with a recursive fake.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ISwapperBehavior`1.ConstructorWillThrow(System.Exception)
member.summary: Specify that an exception will be thrown the next time a construction is encountered for the type
member.param: The exception that will be thrown when the constructor is called

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler
member.summary: Returned by , this interface contains methods for verifying the method calls and checking their arguments.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.WasCalledWithAnyArguments(System.Action)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a method was called, without checking its arguments.
member.param: A void method in the form of a Lambda Expression that we want to verify if was called.
member.exception: Thrown if the method, or chain of methods was not called.
member.remarks: This can also be a chain of methods. In that case, the verification is on the entire chain, and not part of it. When arguments are specified, they are ignored in the verification.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.WasCalledWithAnyArguments``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a method was called, without checking its arguments.
member.param: A method returning a value in the form of a Lambda Expression that we want to verify if was called.
member.exception: Thrown if the method, or chain of methods was not called.
member.remarks: This can also be a chain of methods. In that case, the verification is on the entire chain, and not part of it. When arguments are specified, they are ignored in the verification.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.WasCalledWithExactArguments(System.Action)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a method was called, and checking its arguments.
member.param: A void method in the form of a Lambda Expression that we want to verify if was called.
member.exception: Thrown if the method, or chain of methods was not called with the specified arguments.
member.remarks: This can also be a chain of methods. In that case, the verification is on the entire chain, and not part of it.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.WasCalledWithExactArguments``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a method was called, and checking its arguments.
member.param: A method returning a value in the form of a Lambda Expression that we want to verify if was called.
member.exception: Thrown if the method, or chain of methods was not called with the specified arguments.
member.remarks: This can also be a chain of methods. In that case, the verification is on the entire chain, and not part of it.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.WasNotCalled(System.Action)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a method was not called regardless of parameters.
member.param: A void method in the form of a Lambda Expression that we want to verify if was called.
member.exception: Thrown if the method, or chain of methods was called at least once.
member.remarks: This can also be a chain of methods. In that case, the verification is on the entire chain, and not part of it.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.WasNotCalled``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a method was not called regardless of parameters.
member.param: A method returning a value in the form of a Lambda Expression that we want to verify if was called.
member.exception: Thrown if the method, or chain of methods was called at least once.
member.remarks: This can also be a chain of methods. In that case, the verification is on the entire chain, and not part of it.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.WasCalledWithArguments``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a method was called, and checking its arguments using custom verifier.
member.param: A method returning a value in the form of a Lambda Expression that we want to verify if was called.
member.exception: Thrown if the method, was not called with arguments matching the custom verifier.
member.remarks: Calls to WasCalledWithArguments must be followed with call to Matching() method.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.WasCalledWithArguments(System.Action)
member.summary: Overloaded. Verifies that a method was called, and checking its arguments using custom verifier.
member.param: A method in the form of a Lambda Expression that we want to verify if was called.
member.exception: Thrown if the method, was not called with arguments matching the custom verifier.
member.remarks: Calls to WasCalledWithArguments must be followed with call to Matching() method.

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVerifyHandler.NonPublic
member.summary: Provides an entry point to verify non-public (private, protected, internal) members

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate
member.summary: This is the entry point to all AAA APIs. Use it to fake, swap, set method behavior and verify calls. The Isolate APIs use fluent interfaces, thus

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.WhenCalled(System.Action)
member.summary: Accepts a method in the form of a Lambda expression, to set a specific behavior on it.
member.param: An Action in a form of a Lambda expression (with no parameters) that expresses the method we want to set a behavior on.
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, WhenCalled should be used with its proceeding methods.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.WhenCalled``1(System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Accepts a method in the form of a parametric Lambda expression, to set a specific behavior on it. The expression's parameters are used to define custom argument matching.
member.param: An Action in a form of a Lambda expression that expresses the method we want to set a behavior on. The parameters passed to the action will be used in the method to define custom arguments matching
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, WhenCalled should be used with its proceeding methods.

member.summary: Accepts a method in the form of a parametric Lambda expression, to set a specific behavior on it. The expression's parameters are used to define custom argument matching.
member.param: A function in a form of a Lambda expression that expresses the method we want to set a behavior on. The parameters passed to the action will be used in the method to define custom arguments matching
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, WhenCalled should be used with its proceeding methods.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.CleanUp
member.summary: CleanUp should be called at the end of a test. It can be substituted with the .

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.TypeMock#ArrangeActAssert#IHideObjectMethods#GetType
member.summary: This is the entry point to all AAA APIs. Use it to fake, swap, set method behavior and verify calls. The Isolate APIs use fluent interfaces, thus

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.Swap
member.summary: A read-only property, used to swap objects and behaviors
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use Swap with one of its proceeding methods - see for details.

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.Fake
member.summary: A read-only property, used to fake a new object.
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use Fake with its proceeding methods - see for details.

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.NonPublic
member.summary: A read-only property, used to fake non public members
member.remarks:
Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use NonPublic with one of its proceeding methods, see
When handling non public (private, protected, internal) class members all access to method names is string-based.

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.Verify
member.summary: Return a verifying object that can verify calls were made or not, and check if their arguments were sent correctly.
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use Verify with one of its proceeding methods: , , and

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Isolate.Invoke
member.summary: A read-only property, used to invoke object members.
member.remarks: The Invoker enables code to fire events of objects.

member.summary: Returned by Isolate.NonPublic., this interface contains methods for faking and setting behavior for non-public (private, protected and internal) index get and set calls

member.summary: Sets specific behavior for a non-public index getter on a an object
member.param: The object to set indexer behavior for.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVoidMatchingHandler`1
member.summary: Interface used to define conditional argument matching when faking behavior. The interface is returned by the method.
member.remarks: This interface allows defining custom argument matching by taking the parameter placeholders provided in Isolate.WhenCalled() and defining a custom checking function around them.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IVoidMatchingHandler`1.AndArgumentsMatch(System.Func{`0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Defines a custom argument matching predicate for the method passed in using its parameter placeholders. The fake behavior specified in the following statement(s) will be returned only if this predicate is evaluated as true on the call's arguments.
member.param: The predicate function. Evaluates the parameter placeholders from WhenCalled() and returns true or false. If this returns true, the following faked behavior will be returned.

member.summary: Interface used to define conditional argument matching when faking behavior. The interface is returned by the method.
member.remarks: This interface allows defining custom argument matching by taking the parameter placeholders provided in Isolate.WhenCalled() and defining a custom checking function around them.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IPublicNonVoidMethodHandler`1
member.summary: Interface for specifying behavior for intercepted calls on public methods returning values. The interface is returned by the method.
member.remarks: This interface allow tweaking the behavior of public methods that has return values.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IPublicNonVoidMethodHandler`1.ReturnRecursiveFake
member.summary: Specify that the intercepted method will return a recursive fake. The real implementation will not be executed.
member.remarks:
ReturnRecursiveFake() is a completing statement for . It is similar to using the behavior setting when creating fake objects with , but applies only to a single method.
Use ReturnRecursiveFake() on a method to fake out calls to the method and any call chains beginning with it. When ReturnRecursiveFake() is called on a method returning an object, a fake object will be returned. That fake object in turn will return fake values for any method calls. ReturnRecursiveFake() on a method returning a value type will set the method to return the default value of that type.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IPublicNonVoidMethodHandler`1.WithExactArguments
member.summary: Specifies that the behavior will only be set on method calls with the exact arguments.

remarks.para: WithExactArguments() is a completing statement for .

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ISwapper
member.summary: Interface used for swapping between object method calls and collection values.
member.remarks: This interface is returned by the Isolate. property.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ISwapper.NextInstance``1
member.summary: Return a swapping object, in order to swap a future instance of type T with an existing fake object.
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use NextInstance with its proceeding method

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ISwapper.AllInstances``1
member.summary: Return a swapping object, in order to swap all past and future instance of type T with an existing fake object. Use this method to set the same behavior on all instances of the same type.
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use AllInstances with its proceeding methods or

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ISwapper.CallsOn(System.Object)
member.summary: Enables swapping one object's implementation with another. Followed by the completing statement .
member.param: The object to swap implementation for
member.remarks: When a method is called on the swapped object, it is replaced with a corresponding implementation (a method with the same signature) on the swapping object. This means that the swapped object will start behaving like the object it was swapped with for all methods they have in common.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IArgumentsMatcher
member.summary: Returned by WasCalledWithArguments(), this interface contains methods for verifying arguments used in method calls.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IArgumentsMatcher.Matching(System.Predicate{System.Object[]})
member.summary: Verifies the argument values passed to against a user provided delegate
member.param: A user provided delegate that is used to verify the actual values passed to the call. This delegate receives an object array with the actual argument values, and returns true if the argument check passes.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker
member.summary: Interface for specifying fake object creation settings. The interface is typed by the preceeding Faker property.
member.remarks: This interface is returned by the property.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.Instance``1
member.summary: Overloaded. Returns a fake instance of type T. Using this overload is equal to using Members.ReturnRecursiveFakes.
member.typeparam: The type of fake object to create.
member.returns: A fake instance of type T.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.Instance``1(TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members)
member.summary: Overloaded. Returns a fake instance of type T.
member.typeparam: The type of the fake instance to be created.
member.param:
Can be one of the following values:
Members ValueDescription
Members.MustSpecifyReturnValues All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will throw a .
Members.ReturnNulls All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will return null values (or zero for value types).
Members.CallOriginal All methods are called. Use to change this behavior.
Members.ReturnRecursiveFakes Default. All void calls are ignored. When calling the fake's methods returning values or properties, they will return a fake value, which presents this behavior recursively. Any deep call will never return a Null value.
member.returns: A fake instance of Type T.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.Instance``1(TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members,TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ConstructorWillBe)
member.summary: Overloaded. Returns a fake instance of type T.
member.typeparam: The type of the fake instance to be created.
member.param:
Can be one of the following values:
Members ValueDescription
Members.MustSpecifyReturnValues All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will throw a .
Members.ReturnNulls All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will return null values (or zero for value types).
Members.CallOriginal All methods are called. Use to change this behavior.
Members.ReturnRecursiveFakes Default. All void calls are ignored. When calling the fake's methods returning values or properties, they will return a fake value, which presents this behavior recursively. Any deep call will never return a Null value.

Can be one of the following values:
ConstructorWillBe ValueDescription
ConstructorWillBe.Ignored Constructor will not be executed when creating the fake object
ConstructorWillBe.Called Execute Constructor when creating the fake object
member.returns: A fake instance of Type T.

Members.CallOriginal All methods are called. Use to change this behavior.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.Instance``1(TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members,TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ConstructorWillBe,TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.BaseConstructorWillBe)
member.summary: Overloaded. Returns a fake instance of type T.

member.param:
Can be one of the following values:
Members ValueDescription
Members.MustSpecifyReturnValues All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will throw a .
Members.ReturnNulls All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will return null values (or zero for value types).
Members.CallOriginal All methods are called. Use to change this behavior.
Members.ReturnRecursiveFakes Default. All void calls are ignored. When calling the fake's methods returning values or properties, they will return a fake value, which presents this behavior recursively. Any deep call will never return a Null value.

Can be one of the following values:
ConstructorWillBe ValueDescription
ConstructorWillBe.Ignored Constructor will not be executed when creating the fake object
ConstructorWillBe.Called Execute Constructor when creating the fake object
Can receive BaseConstructorWillBe.Ignored. Means that the constructor of the base class will not be called when creating the fake object. Applicable only when is ConstructorWillBe.Called
member.returns: A fake instance of Type T.
member.exception: Thrown if faking a base class constructor for a type that inherits directly from System.Object (or other mscorlib types)
Thrown if faking an interface - to fake an interface use an overload that does not define base class behavior

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.StaticConstructor``1
member.summary: Overloaded. Fake future calls to static constructors of the given type.
member.typeparam: The type for which to fake static constructor calls
member.exception: Thown if the static constructor for the provided type has already been called, if an instance fake of the type has already been created or if FakeStaticConstructors has already been called for it.
member.remarks: This overload for FakeStaticConstructor receives a generic parameter. Because static classes cannot be instantiated, they also cannot be used as generic type parameters. In order to fake the static constructors for a static class, use the non generic overload which receives a Type parameter.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.StaticConstructor(System.Type)
member.summary: Overloaded. Fake future calls to static constructors of the given type.
member.param: The type for which to fake static constructor calls
member.exception: Thrown if the static constructor for the provided type has already been called, if an instance fake of the type has already been created or if FakeStaticConstructors has already been called for it.
member.remarks: This overload for FakeStaticConstructor receives a Type parameter which represents the class to fake static constructors for, and should be used when faking constructors for static classes. For other non-static classes it is generally recommended to use the generic overload , which receives the class as a generic type argument.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.StaticMethods``1
member.summary: Overloaded. Fakes all static methods for type T. Using this overload is equal to using Members.MustSpecifyReturnValues.
member.typeparam: The type to fake static methods for.
member.remarks: Static class cannot be used as type argument. Use IFaker.StaticMethods(Type type) or IFaker.StaticMethods(Type type, Members behavior) instead.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.StaticMethods(System.Type)
member.summary: Overloaded. Fakes all static methods for the provided type. Using this overload is equal to using Members.ReturnRecursiveFakes.
member.param: The type to fake static methods for.
member.remarks: This overload receives a Type parameter representing the class to fake static methods for, and should be used when faking methods for static classes. For other non-static classes it is generally recommended to use the generic overload , which receives the class as a generic type argument.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.StaticMethods``1(TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members)
member.summary: Overloaded. Fakes all static methods for type .
member.typeparam: The type to fake static methods for.
member.param:
Can be one of the following values:
Members ValueDescription
Members.MustSpecifyReturnValues Default. All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will throw a .
Members.ReturnNulls All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will return null values (or zero for value types).
Members.CallOriginal All methods are called. Use to change this behavior.
Members.ReturnRecursiveFakes All void calls are ignored. When calling the fake's methods returning values or properties, they will return a fake value, which presents this behavior recursively. Any deep call will never return a Null value.
member.returns: A fake instance of Type T.
member.remarks: Static class cannot be used as type argument. Use IFaker.StaticMethods(Type type) or IFaker.StaticMethods(Type type, Members behavior) instead.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IFaker.StaticMethods(System.Type,TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members)
member.summary: Overloaded. Fakes all static methods for the given type.
member.param: The type to fake static methods for.

Can be one of the following values:
Members ValueDescription
Members.MustSpecifyReturnValues Default. All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will throw a .
Members.ReturnNulls All void calls are ignored. Unless using on methods that return values and properties, they will return null values (or zero for value types).
Members.CallOriginal All methods are called. Use to change this behavior.
Members.ReturnRecursiveFakes All void calls are ignored. When calling the fake's methods returning values or properties, they will return a fake value, which presents this behavior recursively. Any deep call will never return a Null value.
member.returns: A fake instance of Type T.
member.remarks: This overload receives a Type parameter representing the class to fake static methods for, and should be used when faking methods for static classes. For other non-static classes it is generally recommended to use the generic overload , which receives the class as a generic type argument.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IDynamicSwapper
member.summary: Interface for performing object to object method call swapping
member.remarks: This interface is returned by calling Isolate.Swap.. Follow it by calling the completing statement.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IDynamicSwapper.WithCallsTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Completes swapping method calls for an object. Is called as a completing statement for Isolate.Swap., and defines the target object to perform swapping on.
member.param: The object whose implementation should be used
member.remarks:
When a method is called on the swapped object, it is replaced with a corresponding implementation (a method with the same signature) on the swapping object. This means that the swapped object will start behaving like the object it was swapped with for all methods they have in common.
When a method is called on the swapped object that does not exist in the target object, it will be called on the original object.
member.exception: If there are no compatible methods to swap between the swapping source and target objects.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIsolateNonPublic
member.summary: Returned by , this interface contains methods for faking and setting behavior for method calls on non public methods, properties and indexers.

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIsolateNonPublic.WhenCalled(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets behavior for a specific method on a an object

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIsolateNonPublic.Property
member.summary: A read only property, used to set behavior on non-public properties
member.remarks:
Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use Property with one of its proceeding methods, see .
When handling non public (private, protected, internal) properties all access to property names is string-based.

member.name: P:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IIsolateNonPublic.Indexer
member.summary: A read only property, used to set behavior on non-public indexers
member.remarks: Because of the nature of fluent interface, you need to use Indexer with one of its proceeding methods, see .

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members
member.summary: A behavior setting on how the fake object is created.

member.name: F:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members.MustSpecifyReturnValues
member.summary: All void calls are ignored. Unless using WhenCalled on methods that return values and properties, they will throw a .

member.name: F:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members.CallOriginal
member.summary: All methods are called. Using WhenCalled allow to change this behavior.

member.name: F:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members.ReturnNulls
member.summary: All void calls are ignored. Unless using WhenCalled on methods that return values and properties, they will return null values (or zero for value types).

member.name: F:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.Members.ReturnRecursiveFakes
member.summary: Default. All void calls are ignored. When calling the fake's methods returning values or properties, they will return a fake value, which presents this behavior recursively. Any deep call will never return a Null value.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ConstructorWillBe
member.summary: A behavior setting on how the fake object is created.
member.remarks: When not using the ConstructorWillBe enum the default behavior for constructor is using the following rules: * When using Members.CallOriginal - The original constructor is called. * When using all other Members enums the constructor is not called.

member.name: F:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ConstructorWillBe.Ignored
member.summary: Don't execute constructor when creating a fake object

member.name: F:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.ConstructorWillBe.Called
member.summary: Run constructor when creating a fake object

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.BaseConstructorWillBe
member.summary: A behavior setting on how the base object's constructor behaves

member.name: F:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.BaseConstructorWillBe.Ignored
member.summary: Don't execute base constructor when creating a fake object.

member.name: T:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IsolatedAttribute
member.summary: Used to clean up the defined expectations. This attribute cant be inherited.
member.remarks: Any method marks with this attribute will clean all set expectation after the test is done. A marked class will do this for any test defined in it. The attribute can be replaced with the method.

example.code: < TestFixture >_ < Isolated >_ ' clear all mocks between tests Public class TestClass < Test >_ Public Sub MyTest1() ' the test code End Sub End Class

member.name: M:TypeMock.ArrangeActAssert.IsolatedAttribute.Execute
member.summary: Called by the framework instead of the original method. This will run the original method and afterwards clear the MockManager.
member.returns: the result of the original method
